sources.title: The Living Skeleton
sources.description: In this atmospheric tale of revenge from beyond the watery grave, a pirate-ransacked freighter’s violent past comes back to haunt a young woman living in a seaside town. Mixing elements of kaidan (ghost stories), doppelgänger thrillers, and mad-scientist movies, Hiroshi Matsuno’s  The Living Skeleton  is a wild and eerie work, with beautiful widescreen, black-and-white cinematography.

metadata.Plot: About a young woman living in a seaside town haunted by the ghosts of a ship's crew murdered by modern-day pirates.
metadata.Actors: Kikko Matsuoka, Yasunori Irikawa, Masumi Okada
